channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Tree at front of 58 Moorend Park Road, 25th October
item.description:
Hi I have spoken with Gloucestershire County Council and they have stated to raise a ticket to carry out a side prune. Please can this be carried out. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 58, Moorend Park Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive and numerous potholes spread across the entire road, 25th October
item.description:
The road is the High Street and the issues stretches all the way from the mini roundabout with Noverton Lane to the junction with The Bank. This whole stretch of road needs digging up and resurfacing as at the moment it resembles a patchwork quilt of botchery.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 54, High Street, Noverton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road Closed Due To Floods Sign Obscured/Wrong Location, 25th October
item.description:
This Sign is often obscured by parked vehicles on the property owners drive & is also obscured by vegetation. It is often missed/ignored by traffic who then find that after travelling quite a distance to around The Red Lion Inn area encounter the flooding & have to do a U turn & return back to the A38. Others have continued along the flooded Lane thinking the flood water depth remains at a constant depth. Then suddenly find themselves in up to 4-5ft of water. The solution would be to move the sign some 5-10 meters along the Lane from the junction so it is more visible to motorists.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wainlode Lane, Norton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unfixed bollard and temp fences., 25th October
item.description:
Bollard is coming out of the ground. The temporary fences fall over every day and block the pavement. This is one of the main roads to the primary school and is often busy with cars. It isn’t acceptable for the children to walk around and into the road to get past.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Union Street, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Number of Potholes have opened up and are quite deep., 25th October
item.description:
The location is known as Pothole Alley on the Cotswold Way / Aggs Hill road. The piece of road is quite dangerous to navigate around the potholes as some are quite deep. Please can they be filled in or better styill this part of the road which is quite well used be resurfaced
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The sign is illegible problem, 25th October
item.description:
30 mph sign is missing on RH side pole is still in situ and intact. New sign needs to be put in place Please pass on to the local AHR for the area to raise as a job.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Impacting sleep, 25th October
item.description:
Many of the houses are single glaze and it's a long strip of damaged road creating a lot of sustained noise.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clarence Road, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
